intro: Solanum vulgatum var. luteum, commonly known as the yellow nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and spiny stems. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, fleshy berries that are yellow when ripe. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
